Class ByteArrayFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xebialabs.overthere.spi.BaseOverthereFile<com.xebialabs.overthere.util.ByteArrayConnection>

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OverthereFile

    public class ByteArrayFile
extends BaseOverthereFile<com.xebialabs.overthere.util.ByteArrayConnection>
    OverthereFile backed by a byte array.

      • getParentFile

        public OverthereFile getParentFile()
        Description copied from interface: OverthereFile
        Return a reference to the parent of this file or null if this file does not have a parent file. The parent of a regular file is the directory that contains it, the parent of a directory is the directory that contains that directory. A root directory does not have a parent.
        Returns:
        the parent of this file or null if this file does not have a parent file.

      • getFile

        public OverthereFile getFile(java.lang.String child)
        Description copied from interface: OverthereFile
        Returns a reference to a named child of this file or null if this file is not a directory. The child file returned may or may not exist.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        getFile in class BaseOverthereFile<com.xebialabs.overthere.util.ByteArrayConnection>
        Parameters:
        child - the name of the child relative to this file. May not contain path separators.
        Returns:
        the child of this file or null if this file is not a directory.

      • renameTo

        public void renameTo(OverthereFile dest)
        Description copied from interface: OverthereFile
        Renames or moves this file. Usually, a file cannot be moved to a different type of connection and sometimes not even to a different connection. Also, it depends on the connaction implementation whether or not the file can be moved accross file system boundaries within that connection.
        Parameters:
        dest - the new location for this file.
